sentence: Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) will begin trading ex-dividend on April 19, 2018.
A cash dividend payment of $0.717 per share is scheduled to be paid on May 15, 2018.
Shareholders who purchased PG prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This represents an 3.91% increase over prior dividend payment.
At the current stock price of $78.43, the dividend yield is 3.66%.
The previous trading day's last sale of PG was $78.43, representing a -17.15% decrease from the 52 week high of $94.67 and a 3.46% increase over the 52 week low of $75.81.
PG is a part of the Basic Industries sector, which includes companies such as Unilever PLC ( UL ) and Unilever NV ( UN ).
PG's current earnings per share, an indicator of a company's profitability, is $3.74.
Zacks Investment Research reports PG's forecasted earnings growth in 2018 as 6.97%, compared to an industry average of 12.8%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the PG Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.
